intro: Leucopogon spathaceus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the south-eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths, heathers, and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped white or pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open heathlands and is often found in coastal areas. Leucopogon spathaceus is an important component of the local flora and plays a role in supporting native insect and bird populations.
